subcommands.name: agent
subcommands.description: listen on a vsocket for trace clients

flags.description: Only use if the client is totally trusted. ***

subcommands.name: attach
subcommands.description: Attach a host and guest trace.dat file

flags.description: offset,scale,fraction[,timestamp] conversion to sync guest timestamp host_file The trace.dat file from the host guest_file The trace.dat file from the guest vcpu_pid list of process ids from the host that represent the vCPUs of the guest

subcommands.name: check-events
subcommands.description: parse trace event formats

subcommands.name: clear
subcommands.description: clear the trace buffers

subcommands.name: convert
subcommands.description: convert trace file to different version

subcommands.name: dump
subcommands.description: read out the meta data from a trace file

subcommands.name: extract
subcommands.description: extract a trace from the kernel

subcommands.name: hist
subcommands.description: show a histogram of the trace.dat information

subcommands.name: list
subcommands.description: list the available events, plugins or options

subcommands.name: listen
subcommands.description: listen on a network socket for trace clients

subcommands.name: profile
subcommands.description: Start profiling and read the output directly

subcommands.name: record
subcommands.description: record a trace into a trace.dat file

flags.description: If a negative number is specified, timestamps synchronization is disabled If 0 is specified, no loop is performed - timestamps offset is calculated only twice, at the beginnig and at the end of the trace

subcommands.name: reset
subcommands.description: disable all kernel tracing and clear the trace buffers

subcommands.name: restart
subcommands.description: restart the kernel trace data recording

subcommands.name: restore
subcommands.description: restore a crashed record

subcommands.name: set
subcommands.description: set a ftrace configuration parameter

subcommands.name: setup-guest
subcommands.description: create FIFOs for tracing guest VMs

subcommands.name: show
subcommands.description: show the contents of the kernel tracing buffer

subcommands.name: snapshot
subcommands.description: take snapshot of running trace

subcommands.name: split
subcommands.description: parse a trace.dat file into smaller file(s)

flags.description: per cpu, that is -p 2 will be 2 pages for each CPU if option is specified, it will split the file up starting at start, and ending at end start - decimal start time in seconds (ex: 75678.923853) if left out, will start at beginning of file end - decimal end time in seconds
split file up by n events
split file up by n milliseconds
split file up by n pages
split file up by n seconds
split file up by n microseconds

subcommands.name: stack
subcommands.description: output, enable or disable kernel stack tracing

subcommands.name: start
subcommands.description: start tracing without recording into a file

subcommands.name: stat
subcommands.description: show the status of the running tracing (ftrace) system

subcommands.name: stop
subcommands.description: stop the kernel from recording trace data

subcommands.name: stream
subcommands.description: Start tracing and read the output directly
